_header: A Danger here I-cast to thee my glove
_description:
Love’s Tournament, translated from the French of Charles d’Orléans (Champollion-Figeac (1842)
XChampollion-Figeac, Aime. Les Poesies du duc Charles d’Orleans. Paris, 1842, 97) — three 15-line stanzas and 8-line Envoy

BLHar682.First Lines:
A Daunger here y cast to thee my gloueAnd thee appele O traytoure
                    of tresoun…
BLHar682.Last Lines:
…But thou shalt dye now speke on thi perellWithout so be thou
                    yelde thee to ben trewe
